ground_truth: They stand next to each other guiltily, as Nullah climbs down from the tree. Sarah stares at him curiously, as he moves pensively away from her. She looks shocked. He eyes her steadily. He draws near her, and she looks up at him. She smiles and looks down at the ground. He gives a tight smile and walks off. She hesitates, then wanders through the long grass. In daylight, a steer lies dead next to a watering hole. Magarri checks the water. Drover, Sarah, and Nullah ride up. Magarri looks thoughtful. It's a great sandy desert. Nullah rides up as they stand glumly at the watering hole. Sarah stares at a solitary figure approaching across the dusty plain. King George is standing on one leg, propped against his spear, staring at them through the swirling dust. They approach him. King George sings, jumps and dances with his spears against the flaming sky of sunset. The cattle move agitatedly through the dust storm which engulfs the drove. King George continues his singing. Nullah dreams his grandfather finds water and catches a fish. In the middle of the twilight desert, King George holds up a fish on a pole. He stands chanting, his long hair, beard, and body caked in dust. Carney offers a pen to the captain. Fletcher hangs up the phone in the cattle pen as the captain pauses over a purchase agreement. The women in the salon watch in wonder as a calf wanders past the window. The building starts to shake as the captain signs the agreement. Sweating in the oppressive Darwin heat, he looks up as the drove thunders into town. Carney frowns and the salon women stare in awe as the street fills with cattle. Carney peers through the slats of his sun-blinds as Sarah rides up. Carney glares at him. They turn their horses and gallop off. Carney dives for the phone. Fletcher stares in angry disbelief as the Drover jumps his horse into the holding yard. Drover rides through the yard, cracking his whip as Fletcher frantically tries to organize his team. The gates out of the pen are closed in front of Drover, and the gate to the wooden loading tunnel raised. Cattle stream into it as Sarah rides toward the docks at the head of her herd. Sarah's herd rumbles on as the laughing Carney men urge their charges into the loading tunnel which runs down the wharf. Drover thinks for a moment, then rides off. He jumps the fence around the yard, knocking out the top slat, and rides into the street outside the Territory Hotel. Fletcher glares at him. Drover looks across at the Carney herd being loaded. He rides towards the large cargo vessel at the end of the wharf.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: They remain adjacent to one another guiltily, as Nullah descends from the tree. Sarah gazes at him inquisitively, as he proceeds pensively away from her. She appears shocked. He observes her steadily. He approaches her, and she glances up at him. She grins and glances down at the ground. He offers a tight grin and strolls off. She pauses, then rambles through the long grass. In daylight, a bullock lies deceased beside a watering hole. Magarri inspects the water. Drover, Sarah, and Nullah ride up. Magarri appears thoughtful. It's a vast sandy wasteland. Nullah rides up as they remain glumly at the watering hole. Sarah gazes at a lone figure advancing across the dusty plain. King George is standing on one leg, leaning against his spear, gazing at them through the swirling dust. They advance toward him. King George chants, leaps, and dances with his spears against the blazing sky of sunset. The livestock move restlessly through the dust storm which envelops the herd. King George continues his chanting. Nullah dreams his grandfather discovers water and captures a fish. In the midst of the twilight wasteland, King George holds up a fish on a pole. He stands reciting, his long hair, beard, and body covered in dust. Carney presents a pen to the captain. Fletcher hangs up the phone in the cattle enclosure as the captain hesitates over a purchase agreement. The women in the salon observe in wonder as a calf roams past the window. The building begins to tremble as the captain signs the agreement. Perspiring in the oppressive Darwin heat, he glances up as the herd thunders into town. Carney scowls and the salon women gaze in awe as the street fills with livestock. Carney peers through the slats of his sun-blinds as Sarah rides up. Carney glowers at him. They turn their steeds and gallop off. Carney lunges for the phone. Fletcher stares in furious disbelief as the Drover leaps his horse into the holding yard. Drover rides through the yard, cracking his whip as Fletcher frantically attempts to organize his crew. The gates out of the pen are shut in front of Drover, and the gate to the wooden loading tunnel lifted. Cattle stream into it as Sarah rides toward the docks at the forefront of her herd. Sarah's herd rumbles on as the laughing Carney men drive their charges into the loading tunnel which runs down the wharf. Drover ponders for a moment, then rides off. He leaps the fence around the yard, dislodging the top slat, and rides into the street outside the Territory Hotel. Fletcher glowers at him. Drover observes across at the Carney herd being loaded. He rides towards the large freight vessel at the end of the wharf.

test_cases.description: Next to each other, they are stood guiltily as Nullah is climbed down from the tree by him. Curious stares are given by Sarah as she watches him move pensively away from her. Shock is shown by her expression. A steady gaze is directed at her by him. He draws near her, and she is looked up at by him. A smile is given by her, and the ground is looked down at by her. A tight smile is given by him, and he walks off. She hesitates, then the long grass is wandered through by her. In daylight, a dead steer is lying next to a watering hole. The water is checked by Magarri. Drover, Sarah, and Nullah ride up. A thoughtful look is given by Magarri. It's a great sandy desert. As they stand glumly at the watering hole, Nullah is ridden up by him. A solitary figure is stared at by Sarah as it approaches across the dusty plain. King George stands on one leg, propped against his spear, while staring at them through the swirling dust. They approach him. Against the flaming sky of sunset, King George sings, jumps, and dances with his spears. The cattle are moved agitatedly through the dust storm which engulfs the drove. King George continues to sing. Nullah dreams that his grandfather finds water and catches a fish. In the middle of the twilight desert, a fish is held up on a pole by King George. He stands chanting, with his long hair, beard, and body caked in dust. A pen is offered to the captain by Carney. The phone in the cattle pen is hung up by Fletcher as a pause is taken by the captain over a purchase agreement. In wonder, the women in the salon watch as a calf is wandered past the window. The building is started to shake as the captain signs the agreement. Sweating in the oppressive Darwin heat, the drove thunders into town as he looks up. Carney frowns, and awe is shown by the salon women as they stare at the street filling with cattle. Through the slats of his sun-blinds, the scene is peered at by Carney as Sarah rides up. Carney glares at him. Horses are turned, and they gallop off. The phone is dived for by Carney. Angry disbelief is displayed by Fletcher as he stares, as the Drover jumps his horse into the holding yard. The yard is ridden through by Drover, and his whip is cracked as Fletcher frantically tries to organize his team. In front of Drover, the gates out of the pen are closed, and the gate to the wooden loading tunnel is raised. Sarah rides toward the docks at the head of her herd as cattle stream into it. Sarah's herd rumbles on as the laughing Carney men urge their charges into the loading tunnel, which runs down the wharf. A moment of thought is taken by Drover, who then rides off. The fence around the yard is jumped by him, knocking out the top slat, and the street outside the Territory Hotel is ridden into. Fletcher glares at him. He looks across at the Carney herd being loaded. Towards the large cargo vessel at the end of the wharf, he rides.

He approaches, she smiles, and he walks off. She hesitates, then wanders through the grass. In daylight, a steer lies dead by a watering hole. test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: They stand side by side, feeling a sense of guilt, as Nullah carefully climbs down from the tall tree. Sarah gazes at him with a curious expression, while he moves away from her with a pensive demeanor. She appears visibly shocked. He meets her gaze steadily. As he draws closer to her, she lifts her eyes to meet his. A smile slowly spreads across her face, and she lowers her eyes to the ground. He responds with a tight-lipped smile before walking away. She hesitates for a moment, then begins to wander aimlessly through the long, swaying grass. In the broad daylight, a steer lies lifeless next to a watering hole. Magarri checks the water with a thoughtful expression. Drover, Sarah, and Nullah ride up to join him. Magarri appears deep in thought. The landscape is a vast, sandy desert. Nullah rides up as they stand glumly by the watering hole. Sarah fixes her gaze on a solitary figure approaching across the dusty, barren plain. King George stands on one leg, leaning against his spear, staring intently at them through the swirling dust. They make their way toward him. King George begins to sing, jumping and dancing with his spears against the backdrop of a flaming sunset sky. The cattle move restlessly through the dust storm that engulfs the drove. King George continues his melodic singing. Nullah dreams of his grandfather discovering water and catching a fish. In the heart of the twilight desert, King George holds a fish aloft on a pole. He stands chanting, his long hair, beard, and body covered in a layer of dust. Carney offers a pen to the captain. Fletcher hangs up the phone in the cattle pen as the captain pauses over a purchase agreement. The women in the salon watch in wonder as a calf wanders past the window. The building begins to shake as the captain signs the agreement. Sweating in the oppressive heat of Darwin, he looks up as the drove thunders into town. Carney frowns, and the salon women stare in awe as the street fills with cattle. Carney peers through the slats of his sun-blinds as Sarah rides up. Carney glares at him. They turn their horses and gallop away. Carney dives for the phone. Fletcher stares in angry disbelief as the Drover jumps his horse into the holding yard. Drover rides through the yard, cracking his whip as Fletcher frantically tries to organize his team. The gates out of the pen are closed in front of Drover, and the gate to the wooden loading tunnel is raised. Cattle stream into it as Sarah rides toward the docks at the head of her herd. Sarah's herd continues to rumble on as the laughing Carney men urge their charges into the loading tunnel that runs down the wharf. Drover pauses to think for a moment, then rides off decisively. He jumps the fence around the yard, knocking out the top slat, and rides into the street outside the Territory Hotel. Fletcher glares at him with intense anger. Drover looks across at the Carney herd being loaded. He rides determinedly towards the large cargo vessel at the end of the wharf.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Side by side they stand, burdened by a palpable sense of guilt that lingers in the air, as young Nullah gingerly descends from the tall, imposing tree. Sarah's eyes follow him with an expression that is filled with curiosity and intrigue, while his demeanor as he moves away from her is contemplative and somewhat withdrawn. She is visibly taken aback by the situation. His eyes meet hers with a steady determination. As he draws nearer to her, she lifts her gaze to meet his, a connection forming between them. A slow, gradual smile begins to spread across her face, and she looks downwards, focusing on the ground beneath her feet. He responds in kind with a small, tight-lipped smile before he turns and walks away. She stands there for a moment, hesitating, before she starts to wander aimlessly through the long, swaying grass that surrounds her. In the full light of day, a steer lies lifeless by a watering hole, an eerie sight. Magarri inspects the water with a thoughtful, contemplative expression on his face. Drover, accompanied by Sarah and Nullah, arrives to join him. Magarri remains deep in thought, pondering the scene. The vast landscape stretches out before them, a seemingly endless expanse of sandy, barren desert. As Nullah rides up to the group standing solemnly by the watering hole, Sarah fixes her gaze on a lone figure making its way across the dusty, desolate plain. King George comes into view, balanced on one leg, his spear providing support as he stares intently at them through the swirling dust. They begin their approach toward him. Suddenly, King George starts to sing, jumping and dancing rhythmically with his spears, silhouetted dramatically against the flaming colors of the sunset sky. The cattle, restless and uneasy, move through the dense dust storm that envelops the drove. King George's melodic singing continues to fill the air. In a dreamlike vision, Nullah envisions his grandfather discovering water and catching a fish. In the heart of the twilight desert, King George stands triumphantly holding a fish aloft on a pole. His voice chants rhythmically, his entire being—hair, beard, and body—coated in a fine layer of dust. Inside, Carney hands a pen to the captain. Meanwhile, Fletcher, stationed in the cattle pen, hangs up the phone as the captain considers signing a purchase agreement. The women sitting inside the salon watch in awe as a calf casually wanders past the window outside. Suddenly, the building begins to shake with intensity as the captain commits to the agreement with his signature. In the oppressive, sweltering heat of Darwin, he looks up just as the thunderous drove charges into town. Carney's face clouds with a frown, and the women in the salon gaze in wonder as the street becomes alive with the presence of cattle. As Sarah gallops up, Carney peers through the slats of his sun-blinds, his expression one of intense disapproval. Their horses turn and gallop away. Carney rushes to the phone, while Fletcher stands in a state of angry disbelief as Drover leaps his horse into the chaotic holding yard. Navigating skillfully, Drover rides across the yard, the sound of his whip cracking loud and clear as Fletcher desperately attempts to organize his team amidst the chaos. The gates of the pen close in front of Drover, while the gate to the wooden loading tunnel opens, and the cattle begin streaming into it. Leading her herd, Sarah rides determinedly toward the docks. Her herd continues its formidable rumble forward as Carney's men, filled with laughter, urge their livestock into the loading tunnel that stretches down the wharf. Drover pauses momentarily, gathering his thoughts, then rides off with determined resolve. He jumps the fence surrounding the yard, knocking out the top slat with force and determination, and swiftly rides into the street outside the Territory Hotel. Fletcher glares at him with intense anger and frustration. Drover's eyes focus on the Carney herd being methodically loaded. With a strong sense of purpose, he rides determinedly toward the large cargo vessel stationed at the end of the wharf.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: They stand side by side, their expressions tinged with guilt, as Nullah carefully descends from the tree, each step deliberate and cautious. Sarah fixes her gaze on him, her curiosity piqued, as he moves away from her with a pensive air, his thoughts seemingly elsewhere. Her face registers shock, her eyes wide and mouth slightly agape. He meets her gaze with a steady, unwavering look, his eyes conveying a depth of emotion. As he draws closer to her, she tilts her head upward to meet his eyes, her expression softening. A smile slowly spreads across her face, and she lowers her gaze to the ground, a hint of shyness in her demeanor. He responds with a tight-lipped smile, a brief expression of acknowledgment, before turning and walking away. She hesitates for a moment, her mind processing the interaction, then begins to wander aimlessly through the long grass, her steps unhurried and contemplative. In the bright daylight, a steer lies lifeless beside a watering hole, its presence a stark reminder of the harsh environment. Magarri approaches the water, inspecting it with a thoughtful expression, his mind working through the implications. Drover, Sarah, and Nullah arrive on horseback, their faces reflecting the gravity of the situation. Magarri's thoughtful demeanor suggests he is considering their next move. The vast expanse of the great sandy desert stretches out before them, its barren beauty both daunting and mesmerizing. Nullah rides up to join them as they stand, their expressions glum, at the edge of the watering hole. Sarah's attention is drawn to a solitary figure making its way across the dusty plain, the figure's movements deliberate and purposeful. King George stands on one leg, leaning against his spear, his gaze fixed on them through the swirling dust, a figure of strength and mystery. As they approach him, King George begins to sing, his voice rising and falling with the rhythm of his movements. He jumps and dances, his spears slicing through the air against the backdrop of a flaming sunset sky. The cattle, agitated by the dust storm, move restlessly, their forms barely visible through the haze that engulfs the drove. King George's singing continues, a haunting melody that echoes across the landscape. In Nullah's dream, his grandfather discovers water and catches a fish, a vision of hope and sustenance. In the heart of the twilight desert, King George stands triumphantly, holding a fish aloft on a pole, his chanting resonating through the air. His long hair, beard, and body are coated in dust, a testament to the harsh conditions. Meanwhile, Carney offers a pen to the captain, a gesture laden with significance. Fletcher, in the cattle pen, hangs up the phone, his expression tense as the captain pauses over a purchase agreement, the weight of the decision palpable. In the salon, women watch in wonder as a calf meanders past the window, its presence a curious anomaly. The building begins to tremble as the captain signs the agreement, the vibrations a prelude to the chaos that follows. Sweating under the oppressive Darwin heat, he looks up just as the drove thunders into town, the sound a deafening roar. Carney frowns, his displeasure evident, while the salon women stare in awe as the street becomes a sea of cattle. Carney peers through the slats of his sun-blinds, his eyes narrowing as Sarah rides up, her presence commanding attention. Carney's glare is intense, a silent challenge. They turn their horses and gallop off, their departure swift and decisive. Carney lunges for the phone, urgency in his movements. Fletcher's face contorts with angry disbelief as the Drover propels his horse into the holding yard, the leap a bold defiance. Drover rides through the yard, his whip cracking sharply in the air, a call to action as Fletcher scrambles to organize his team, his efforts frantic. The gates of the pen close in front of Drover, a barrier to his progress, while the gate to the wooden loading tunnel rises, allowing cattle to stream into it. Sarah leads her herd toward the docks, her position at the head a testament to her leadership. Her herd continues its rumbling advance as the Carney men, laughing, urge their charges into the loading tunnel that extends down the wharf. Drover pauses, considering his options, then makes a decision and rides off with determination. He jumps the fence surrounding the yard, the impact knocking out the top slat, and emerges onto the street outside the Territory Hotel. Fletcher's glare follows him, a silent accusation. Drover's gaze shifts to the Carney herd being loaded, assessing the situation. He directs his horse toward the large cargo vessel at the end of the wharf, his path clear and resolute.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: They stand guiltily as Nullah climbs down from the tree and moves pensively away, leaving Sarah shocked. After a brief exchange of glances and smiles, he walks off, and she hesitantly wanders through the long grass. In daylight, they find a dead steer by a watering hole, where Magarri checks the water as Drover, Sarah, and Nullah arrive. In the great sandy desert, they stand glumly at the watering hole while Sarah notices King George approaching across the dusty plain. King George, standing on one leg with his spear, sings and dances against the sunset sky. Amidst a dust storm, the cattle move agitatedly as King George continues his song. Nullah dreams of his grandfather finding water and catching a fish, which King George later holds up on a pole while chanting in the twilight desert. Meanwhile, Carney offers a pen to the captain, who pauses over a purchase agreement as Fletcher hangs up the phone in the cattle pen. The women in the salon watch in wonder as a calf wanders past, and the building shakes when the captain signs the agreement. As the drove thunders into town, Carney frowns, and the salon women stare in awe at the street filling with cattle. Carney peers through his sun-blinds as Sarah rides up, and after a glare, they gallop off, prompting Carney to dive for the phone. Fletcher watches in disbelief as Drover jumps his horse into the holding yard, riding through and cracking his whip while Fletcher scrambles to organize his team. The gates close in front of Drover, directing cattle into the loading tunnel as Sarah leads her herd toward the docks. As the Carney men urge their cattle into the tunnel, Drover briefly considers his options, then jumps the yard fence, knocking out the top slat, and rides into the street outside the Territory Hotel. He observes the Carney herd being loaded and rides toward the large cargo vessel at the end of the wharf.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: They stand next to each other guiltily, as Nullah, a young Aboriginal boy known for his deep connection to the land and mystical heritage, climbs down from the tree. Sarah stares at him curiously, as he moves pensively away from her. She looks shocked, perhaps pondering the cultural significance of his actions in their shared journey through the Australian Outback. He eyes her steadily. He draws near her, and she looks up at him. She smiles and looks down at the ground, absorbing the moment's gravity. He gives a tight smile and walks off, understanding the weight of unspoken words between them. She hesitates, then wanders through the long grass typical of the vast, untamed Australian landscape. In daylight, a steer lies dead next to a watering hole, a precious source of water in this arid environment. Magarri, an experienced cattleman and trusted ally, checks the water for signs of contamination. Drover, Sarah, and Nullah ride up, their mission in this unforgiving land relentless. Magarri looks thoughtful, contemplating the challenges they face. It's a great sandy desert, part of the vast, desolate stretches of the Northern Territory. Nullah rides up as they stand glumly at the watering hole, aware of the harsh realities of survival. Sarah stares at a solitary figure approaching across the dusty plain. King George, Nullah's grandfather and a revered elder among his people, is standing on one leg, propped against his spear, staring at them through the swirling dust. They approach him, understanding his spiritual connection to the land and its stories. King George sings, jumps, and dances with his spears against the flaming sky of sunset, performing a ritual that speaks to his people's deep cultural traditions. The cattle move agitatedly through the dust storm which engulfs the drove, driven by the relentless forces of nature. King George continues his singing, calling on the spirits of his ancestors. Nullah dreams his grandfather finds water and catches a fish, a symbol of hope and sustenance. In the middle of the twilight desert, King George holds up a fish on a pole, embodying the harmony between his people and their environment. He stands chanting, his long hair, beard, and body caked in dust, a testament to the harshness of the Outback. Carney offers a pen to the captain, a gesture signifying the closing of an important deal. Fletcher hangs up the phone in the cattle pen as the captain pauses over a purchase agreement, a pivotal moment in their business dealings. The women in the salon watch in wonder as a calf wanders past the window, unexpectedly drawn into the drama unfolding outside. The building starts to shake as the captain signs the agreement, a foreboding sign of the impending chaos. Sweating in the oppressive Darwin heat, the tropical climate known for its humidity, he looks up as the drove thunders into town. Carney frowns and the salon women stare in awe as the street fills with cattle, illustrating the overwhelming scale of the operation. Carney peers through the slats of his sun-blinds as Sarah rides up, her determination visible as she confronts the situation. Carney glares at him, his expression conveying his opposition. They turn their horses and gallop off, their urgency palpable. Carney dives for the phone, seeking to control the unfolding events. Fletcher stares in angry disbelief as the Drover, a skilled and fearless cowboy known throughout the region, jumps his horse into the holding yard. Drover rides through the yard, cracking his whip as Fletcher frantically tries to organize his team, highlighting the chaotic nature of the cattle trade. The gates out of the pen are closed in front of Drover, and the gate to the wooden loading tunnel raised, guiding the cattle into their intended path. Cattle stream into it as Sarah rides toward the docks at the head of her herd, her leadership crucial in this high-stakes scenario. Sarah's herd rumbles on as the laughing Carney men, confident in their control, urge their charges into the loading tunnel which runs down the wharf, a key transit point for shipping livestock. Drover thinks for a moment, then rides off, his quick decision-making a hallmark of his character. He jumps the fence around the yard, knocking out the top slat, and rides into the street outside the Territory Hotel, a local landmark known to all in the town. Fletcher glares at him, his frustration mounting. Drover looks across at the Carney herd being loaded, assessing the competition. He rides towards the large cargo vessel at the end of the wharf, intent on ensuring his cattle reach their destination.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: They stand next to each other guiltily as Nullah climbs down from the tree. Sarah stares at him curiously as he moves pensively away from her. She looks shocked. He eyes her steadily. He draws near her and she looks up at him. She smiles and looks down at the ground. He gives a tight smile and walks off. She hesitates then wanders through the long grass. In daylight a steer lies dead next to a watering hole. Magarri checks the water. Drover. Sarah and Nullah ride up. Magarri looks thoughtful. It is a great sandy desert. Nullah rides up as they stand glumly at the watering hole. Sarah stares at a solitary figure approaching across the dusty plain. King George is standing on one leg propped against his spear staring at them through the swirling dust. They approach him. King George sings jumps and dances with his spears against the flaming sky of sunset. The cattle move agitatedly through the dust storm which engulfs the drove. King George continues his singing. Nullah dreams. his grandfather finds water and catches a fish. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. In the middle of the twilight desert. King George holds up a fish on a pole. He stands chanting his long hair beard and body caked in dust. Carney offers a pen to the captain. Fletcher hangs up the phone in the cattle pen as the captain pauses over a purchase agreement. The women in the salon watch in wonder as a calf wanders past the window. The building starts to shake as the captain signs the agreement. Sweating in the oppressive Darwin heat he looks up as the drove thunders into town. Carney frowns and the salon women stare in awe as the street fills with cattle. Carney peers through the slats of his sunblinds as Sarah rides up. Carney glares at him. They turn their horses and gallop off. Carney dives for the phone. Fletcher stares in angry disbelief as the Drover jumps his horse into the holding yard. Drover rides through the yard cracking his whip as Fletcher frantically tries to organize his team. The gates out of the pen are closed in front of Drover and the gate to the wooden loading tunnel. raised Cattle stream into it as Sarah rides toward the docks at the head of her herd. Sarah's herd rumbles on as the laughing Carney men urge their charges into the loading tunnel which runs down the wharf. Drover thinks for a moment then rides off. He jumps the fence around the yard knocking out the top slat and rides into the street outside the Territory Hotel. Fletcher glares at him. Drover looks across at the Carney herd being loaded. He rides towards the large cargo vessel at the end of the wharf.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: They stand next to each other guiltily as Nullah climbs down from the tree. Sarah stares at him curiously as he moves pensively away from her. She looks shocked. He eyes her steadily. He draws near her and she looks up at him. She smiles and looks down at the ground. He gives a tight smile and walks off. She hesitates then wanders through the long grass. In daylight a steer lies dead next to a watering hole. Magarri checks the water. Drover. Sarah and Nullah ride up. Magarri looks thoughtful. It is a great sandy desert. Nullah rides up as they stand glumly at the watering hole. Sarah stares at a solitary figure approaching across the dusty plain. King George is standing on one leg propped against his spear staring at them through the swirling dust. They approach him. King George sings jumps and dances with his spears against the flaming sky of sunset. The cattle move agitatedly through the dust storm which engulfs the drove. King George continues his singing. Nullah dreams. his grandfather finds water and catches a fish. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: They float beside one another sheepishly, as Nimbus descends from the ladder. Clara gapes at him inquisitively, as he drifts thoughtfully away from her. She feels bewildered. He glances at her intently. He approaches her, and she gazes upward at him. She grins and glances down at the pebbles. He offers a faint grin and strides away. She pauses, then meanders through the tall ferns. In daylight, a badger rests lifeless beside a pond. Monroe inspects the liquid. Wanderer, Clara, and Nimbus trot up. Monroe appears pensive. It's a vast icy tundra. Nimbus trots up as they linger somberly at the pond. Clara gazes at a lone silhouette advancing across the barren terrain. Chief Albert is balancing on one foot, leaning on his cane, observing them through the shifting mist. They advance toward him. Chief Albert hums, skips, and twirls with his canes against the blazing horizon of dusk. The sheep move restlessly through the windstorm which envelops the flock. Chief Albert continues his humming. Nimbus imagines his ancestor discovers a spring and hooks a coral reef. In the middle of the twilight tundra, Chief Albert raises a coral reef on a stick. He stands chanting, his long mane, whiskers, and figure encrusted in dirt. Larson extends a quill to the admiral. Butcher hangs up the receiver in the sheep pen as the admiral hesitates over a trade contract. The children in the parlor gaze in astonishment as a fawn meanders past the curtain. The structure begins to tremble as the admiral completes the contract. Perspiring in the stifling Melbourne warmth, he glances upward as the flock roars into the village. Larson scowls and the parlor children gaze in wonder as the avenue fills with sheep. Larson squints through the gaps in his sun-shades as Clara trots up. Larson scowls at him. They pivot their llamas and sprint away. Larson lunges for the receiver. Butcher gazes in furious disbelief as the Wanderer leaps his llama into the holding space. Wanderer rides through the space, snapping his lasso as Butcher desperately attempts to rally his crew. The portals out of the pen are sealed in front of Wanderer, and the portal to the wooden loading corridor elevated. Sheep flow into it as Clara trots toward the pier at the front of her flock. Clara's flock rumbles on as the chuckling Larson crew encourage their wards into the loading corridor which extends down the quay. Wanderer ponders for a moment, then trots away. He leaps the railing around the space, dislodging the top bar, and rides into the avenue outside the Territory Inn. Butcher scowls at him. Wanderer gazes across at the Larson flock being loaded. He trots toward the enormous freight barge at the end of the quay.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: They stand together guiltily as Nullah descends from the tree. Sarah watches him as he moves away, momentarily exchanging a glance and a smile. In the desert, Magarri checks water by a dead steer. Drover, Sarah, and Nullah arrive to find King George singing and dancing amid a dust storm. Nullah dreams of his grandfather finding water and holding up a fish. Meanwhile, Carney gives a pen to the captain to sign a purchase agreement, as the building trembles from cattle thundering into town. Carney watches Sarah ride up and glares. He dives for the phone while Fletcher frantically organizes his team. Drover rides through the yard, cracking his whip, and jumps the fence, heading toward the docks. Sarah leads her herd onto a cargo vessel, as Drover rides into the street, heading toward the wharf.
